dt: {bc}to have a dulling or inhibiting effect on
{bc}to cause to appear or be stupid, foolish, or absurdly illogical
{bc}to allege or prove to be of unsound mind and hence not responsible

et: Late Latin {it}stultificare{/it} to make foolish, from Latin {it}stultus{/it} foolish; akin to Latin {it}stolidus{/it} stolid
shortdef: to have a dulling or inhibiting effect on
to impair, invalidate, or make ineffective : negate
to cause to appear or be stupid, foolish, or absurdly illogical
